p:
The precise drivers of death, regardless of sex, in COVID-19 remain unknown. There appears to be a subset of patients in whom high levels of dysregulated inflammation lead to severe multisystem organ pathology
1, 2 . A postviral inflammatory syndrome has also emerged in children with COVID-19 (refs
3, 4 ). As a result, research on therapeutics has focused on both antiviral and immunomodulatory pathways
2, 5 with the goal of achieving an optimized balance in immune response induction and resolution. Unfortunately, most studies fail to consider the sex of the patients, which may mask therapeutic targets.
